data.title: Family friendly...always yummy
data.text: The food is always fresh and a very kid friendly environment !   Been eating here for years!  Their hot/ sour soup is flavorful, and is included with dine in.

data.title: Quick take out - delicious meals
data.text: One of our favorites. General chicken, sesame chicken, sweet and sour chicken, crab rangoon, egg rolls. All delicious!! Quick and pleasant service. Whether eat in or take out, you will like it. Check it out.

data.title: Favorite place
data.text: We have been coming to this place since it opened. The food and the service are always great. Very economical place to have dinner. Most meals are under $8 and include soup and an egg roll. Recommend to all our friends.

data.title: 300 miles for chinese
data.text: We moved from omaha 15 years ago and constantly talk about our 2 favorite restaurants we miss.     Three happiness is our #1 and we actually drive 300 miles to get our fix.  The food is made fresh and the flavors ooo the flavors.  I can not find anything that can compare.  I always order the hot and spicy chicken.  Love the crunch of the celery and crispy chicken drownding in a sweet and spicy sauce.  If you like hot and need a cure for your sinuses try their hot and sour soup.  You will not be disapointed.

data.title: Great food, very reasonably priced,  great service and staff - YUM!!
data.text:
I went with a friend for Chinese and based on the reviews, we tried Three Happiness Express and were not disappointed.  

It is located in a small strip mall, very unassuming and very casual but the food is DELICIOUS.  

I had the Hot and Sour Soup (good – not quite traditional – but still very good), the Ming’s Beef and the Black Pepper Chicken; both were outrageously good and were each served on a plate with a mound of rice.  

My dining partner had the Wonton Soup (huge bowl for two) and Broccoli Chicken with the addition of carrots and shrimp – which they accommodated with no issues.  

Also were their very yummy spring rolls.  They also have an extensive vegetarian menu.

Great food, very reasonably priced,  great service and staff and I would DEFINITELY dine here again – often – if I lived in Omaha.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: I ate here with my family and everybody loved their food. For about 9 bucks you get a giant portion, and egg roll and soup. The hot and sour soup was great. I had peanut butter chicken and it was great; a little heavy on the sauce but still great. Service was good and the place is clean. This is my new "go to" for Chinese food.

data.title: midtown gem
data.text: this is a very busy midtown Chinese eatery. Often at peak times, it is not unusual to have a longer wait for your meal. They do a lot of take out as well as in house customers.  The food is great, LOTS of variety and unusual dishes. Be sure to check the specials on the window and front board as you come it, there are often about 15 items that may be seasonal or special.  I like the chili chicken, when is battered fried white meat with a vinegar chili dipping sauce. Served with steamed broccoli.   Hot and sour soup is great.

data.title: fabulous
data.text: One of the best Sesame Chicken dinners i've ever had. Very big take out portions and my favorite cheat meal on my diet :)

data.title: Big portions
data.text: We get takeout once in a while. The portions are really big, so go hungry. They make a peanut butter chicken that is great, but it is super rich!!

data.title: Best Chinese Food in Town
data.text: This is my 'go to' place for Chinese food in Omaha.  I 've been enjoying Three Happiness for over decade.  The food is fantastic and very affordable.  I highly recommend.

data.title: Lots of Good food, low prices
data.text: The food is good and the portions are large.  The place is pretty low-key but it is clean.  They have really good specials that are not on the regular menu.  The prices are really low but they can be kinda slow.  A good place for lunch but not if you are in a big hurry.  Certainly not a fancy place but I like it and have been here many times for lunch with co-workers and dinner with my family.

data.title: Great food in an out of the way place.
data.text: Food was great! Had a little bit of a wait, but was well worth it. Prices are good and the sweet and sour chicken is by far the best in Omaha.

data.title: Peanut Butter Chicken = Amazing!
data.text:
Peanut butter chicken.  

That's all that needs to be said really.  I actually enjoy the amount of sauce as other places like to charge you for extra and usually skimp on them horribly.

data.title: Seriously great find
data.text: Huge selection. Unbelievably reasonable prices. Fresh veggies. Delicious sauces. Good quality meats. Can't beat this place for cheap, tasty and fresh Chinese.

data.title: Delicious Chinese
data.text: First of all are the friendly staff. I love this restaurant because it is such delicious food and I can walk there. Their staff is so friendly I always feel special. Prices are great for the quantity of food they serve. Overall my favorite Chinese restaurant in Omaha.

data.title: Great food!
data.text:
This restaurant is nondescript on the outside - located in a little strip mall. But for the reviews, I don't think I'd have ever noticed it, let alone decided to stop on in for dinner. So glad we decided to give it a try. 

Service was excellent and prompt. The restaurant atmosphere is clean and basic. They were doing very swift business in take-out meals at the counter.

The menu is large - and everything very very reasonably priced. We decided to try the recommended Peanut Butter Chicken the other reviewers have talked about, and sweet and sour chicken with the sauce on the side for my picky teenager. Each dinner came with Crab Rangoon or Egg Roll and your choice of soup. The hot and sour soup was wonderful. The PB Chicken was fantastic - so glad I ordered this! My picky teenager was soon skewering bits of chicken off my plate. We had enough for a large dinner and leftovers. My never-eats-leftovers teen also gobbled up what we took home for lunch the next day. 

This will be our new 'must go to' when we're in Omaha.

data.title: Food and Service that is "Normally" Well Above the Others
data.text:
My family have been eating at this restaurant for several years.  As to food - our Chinese experience include over 10 months in China.  So we see and taste food that as authentic as American's can handle.  But when you go to eat - if you like something, and return in a month - you will find it once again very good.  So they have a stabile product.  Dining is simple, yet wonderful.  You will get your food within about 60 seconds of it leaving the Wok, and if there is several of you, you will get food one at a time and if you take a bite you WILL burn your mouth big time....

I have always had a favorite set of dishes of Ginger Chicken and/or Basil Chicken (which is Ginger Chicken with a lot of fresh basil).  I really enjoy the Won Ton soup which is overmuch like I and used to from inland China.

Sometimes you can wait a bit for food...  But the fact that it is filled with returning customers who don't mind waiting should speak for itself.

data.title: Great food and reasonable prices!
data.text: Love this place for either eat-in or carryout.  Service is prompt and friendly.  Entrees are freshly-prepared, therefore they are hot, veggies remain crisp, and seasonings are great.  Have had great seafood, chicken and meat dishes and have not been disappointed.  Heartily recommend this place.   If you're going to be coming in with a group, it's best to give them a heads-up so a table can be saved.

data.title: Best food,best value
data.text: We have been eating here since it opened! So a seriously long time and have never been disappointed.The food is terrific and very reasonable. Our favorites are cashew chicken and the lo mein. The crab rangoon, egg rolls and fried dumplings are also super. Service is usually good, unless they are busy, you seat yourself. We usually go in but you can get carrying as well. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great food at an even greater price
data.text: The peanut butter chicken and the Mongolian Triple Crown are to die for.  If you eat in the restaurant (and they do a LOT of takeout), you get the soup and an eggroll or crab Rangoon with your meal.  The iced tea is always perfect and the service is quite good.  And you would expect higher prices, but this Chinese restaurant has very low prices and lots of food. I always get a to go box and they box it, bag it and tie it up so it has a little handle.
